relation: Name of the input service policy applied to the specified interface.

Class of traffic being displayed. Output is displayed for each configured class in the policy. The choice for implementing class matches (for example, match-all or match-any) can also appear next to the traffic class.
Number of the packets (also shown in bytes) identified as belonging to the class of traffic being displayed.
Rate, in kbps, of packets coming in to the class.
Rate, in kbps, at which packets are dropped from the class. The drop rate is calculated by subtracting the number of successfully transmitted packets from the offered rate.

Match criteria specified for the class of traffic. In this example, the Frame Relay Discard Eligible (DE) bit has been specified as the match criterion. For more information about the variety of match criteria that are available, see the “Classifying Network Traffic” module in the Cisco IOS Quality of Service Solutions Configuration Guide.
Indicates that tunnel marking has been configured to set the DSCP in the header of a tunneled packet to a value of 3.
pageTitle: Quality of Service Solutions Command Reference, Cisco IOS XE Release 3SE (Cisco WLC 5700 Series) - P through V [Cisco 5700 Series Wireless LAN Controllers] - Cisco
title: Table 36 show policy-map interface Field Descriptions—Configured for Tunnel Marking
TableContextTimeStampBeforeTable: {1829=This command was integrated into Cisco IOS XE Release 2.1 and implemented on Cisco ASR 1000 series routers.}
TableContextTimeStampAfterTable: {210047=This command was integrated into Cisco IOS XE Release 2.1 and was implemented on the Cisco ASR 1000 series router., 434816=20 % * 2048 kbps = 409600 bps, 319297=Cisco 3660, 3845, 7200, 7400, 7500, Cisco ASR 903 Series Routers, and Cisco ASR 1000 Series Routers, 436609=40 % * 2048 kbps = 819200 bps, 434210=According to the output from the show interfaces command for the serial 2/0 interface, the interface has a bandwidth (BW) of 2048 kbps., 318415=This command was modified. The pseudowire interface type was added on Cisco 1000 Series Routers., 37853=This command was implemented on Cisco ASR 1000 Series Routers., 283417=This command was implemented on Cisco ASR 1000 series routers., 41140=The Cisco 10000 series router, the Cisco ASR 1000 Series Router, and the Cisco ASR 903 Series Router support two levels of priority service: level 1 (high) and level 2 (low). If you do not specify a priority level, the routers use the default level of 1. Level 1 specifies that low-latency behavior must be given to the traffic class. The high-level queues are serviced until empty before the next-level queues and non-priority queues., 249=For QoS class maps on Cisco 7600 series routers, the limits are 1024 class maps and 256 classes in a policy map., 449226=As of Cisco IOS Release 12.2(31)SB2, matching packets on the basis of VLAN ID numbers is supported on the Catalyst 1000 platform only., 41010=Cisco 10000 Series Router, Cisco ASR 1000 Series Router, and Cisco ASR 903 Series Router, 392731=The following sample output from the show policy-map interface command displays the statistics for the Serial2/0 interface, to which a policy map called “policy1” is attached. The discarding action has been specified for all the packets belonging to a class called “c1.” In this example, 32000 bps of traffic is sent (“offered”) to the class and all of them are dropped. Therefore, the drop rate shows 32000 bps., 187673=This command was implemented on Cisco ASR 1000 series routers., 35464=Valid values are from 1 (high priority) to 4 (low priority). Default is 1. For Cisco ASR 1000 Series Routers and the Cisco ASR 903 Series Routers, valid values are from 1 (high priority) to 2 (low priority). Default is 1., 87042=2049}

To delete a policy map, use the no form of this command. policy-map vbr-nrt show
textAfterTable: Name of the control policy map. service (Optional) Creates a service policy map. service-name Name of the policy-map service. class-routing Configures the class-routing policy map. ipv4 Configures the class-routing IPv4 policy map. unicast Configures the class-routing IPv4 unicast policy map. unicast-name Unicast policy-map name.
